    • Field Detail

      • intervalMillis

        protected final int intervalMillis

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgressLineEmitter

        public ProgressLineEmitter()
        Creates a ProgressLineEmitter which outputs every 0.1 seconds and shows the approximated remaining time. A line is only emitted if something changed. Use ProgressLineEmitter(String, int, boolean, boolean) if you need some options.
        See Also:
        ProgressLineEmitter(String, int, boolean, boolean)

      • ProgressLineEmitter

        public ProgressLineEmitter(String title,
                   int intervalMillis,
                   boolean showApproxTimeRemaining,
                   boolean onlyIfChanged)
        Creates a ProgressLineEmitter with full control over all options.
        Parameters:
        title - a title which is printed before the output of the percentage done
        intervalMillis - the interval in milli seconds between output of the percentage done
        showApproxTimeRemaining - whether to show an approximation of the remaining time
        onlyIfChanged - do only emit a progress line if anything really changed

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(ProgressInformationProvider progressInfoProv)
        Description copied from interface: ProgressMonitor
        Notifies this progress monitor that trace iteration starts on the given iterator. The progress monitor can then asynchronously check the percentage done, and process this information.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ProgressMonitor
        Parameters:
        progressInfoProv - an object from which the current percentage done can be retrieved

      • end

        public void end()
        Description copied from interface: ProgressMonitor
        Notifies this progress monitor that trace iteration has finished.
        Specified by:
        end in interface ProgressMonitor
